snippet: A federal judge in Manhattan held a police officer immune for actions that included shooting a man in the Bronx, but the officer would have to stand trial on whether firing the final shot was reasonable.
abstract: Federal Judge Katherine B Forrest issues preliminary ruling in excessive force lawsuit against New York City police officers in case of Mauricio Jaquez, emotionally disturbed man killed in his Bronx apartment after threatening his family and stabbing at responding officers; concludes officers acted reasonably and are immune from civil liability, with exception of final bullet fired by Sgt William Flores, for which he will stand trial.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Manhattan held a police officer immune for actions that included shooting a man in the Bronx, but the officer would have to stand trial on whether firing the final shot was reasonable.

headline.main: Judge Holds Officers’ Actions in Fatal Shooting Immune, Except for Final Bullet
headline.print_headline: Judge in Pending Suit Holds Officers’ Actions in Fatal Shooting Immune, Except One

keywords.name: persons
keywords.value: Flores, William (New York, NY, Police Officer)
